data.question: What is the name of the metal-organic framework (MOF) reported in the study?
What is the proton conductivity of BUT-8(Cr)A at 100% RH and 80°C?
Does BUT-8(Cr)A maintain high proton conductivity across a wide range of relative humidity (RH)?
What is the role of sulfonic acid (–SO3H) sites in BUT-8(Cr)A?
data.answer: They arrange on channel surfaces for proton conduction.

data.question: Is BUT-8(Cr)A chemically stable in water?
What is the structural feature of BUT-8(Cr)A that contributes to its flexibility?
data.answer: It has a three-dimensional framework structure with one-dimensional channels.

data.question: Can BUT-8(Cr)A self-adapt its framework under different humid environments?
What is the significance of the high density of sulfonic acid sites in BUT-8(Cr)A?
data.answer: It ensures smooth proton conduction pathways mediated by water molecules.

data.question: Is the proton conductivity of BUT-8(Cr)A higher than that of most reported MOFs?
What is the formula for BUT-8(Cr)A?
How does BUT-8(Cr)A compare to Nafion in terms of proton conductivity?
data.answer: Its proton conductivity at 80 °C and 100% RH is comparable to that of Nafion.

data.question: Does BUT-8(Cr)A demonstrate structural flexibility in response to humidity changes?
What is the activation energy (Ea) of BUT-8(Cr)A?
Is the proton conductivity of BUT-8(Cr)A dependent on the water content?
What mechanism is proposed for the proton conduction in BUT-8(Cr)A?
Does BUT-8(Cr)A retain its high proton conductivity over time?
What is the role of water molecules in the proton conduction of BUT-8(Cr)A?
data.answer: Protons primarily migrate through the inner pores of the MOFs, mediated by water molecules.

data.question: Is BUT-8(Cr)A thermally stable?
What is the chemical stability of BUT-8(Cr)A in acidic conditions?
data.answer: It is stable even in 10 M sulfuric acid or concentrated hydrochloric acid for one week.

data.question: Does the structural transformation of BUT-8(Cr)A contribute to its proton conductivity?
